Files | Macros | Functions
Application UART helper APIs
Sample Example API » Sample Example - Utility library API

Files

file  bsputils_uart.h
 Header file to use application level uart helper functions.
 

Macros

#define BSP_UTILS_UART_RX_DEFAULT_TIMEOUT   (10U)
 Uart default timeout.
 
#define BSP_UTILS_UART_RX_WAIT_FOREVER   (0xFFFFFFFFU)
 Timeout value to be passed to have blocking uart read.

 Reads string from UART console. This breaks on carraige return or timeout or char read exceeds the buffer size. This will also terminate the string with NULL character. More...

Detailed Description

Function Documentation

Bool BspUtils_isUartInitDone ( void  )

Returns if the UART initialization is done.

Returns
TRUE if initialization is done, else FALSE
Int32 BspUtils_uartGetChar ( char *  pRxBuffer,
UInt32  timeoutVal 
)

Reads a char from UART console.

Parameters
pRxBuffer[OUT] Character read from UART
timeoutVal[IN] Timeout value in seconds. Pass BSP_UTILS_UART_RX_WAIT_FOREVER to wait forever.
Returns
None
Int32 BspUtils_uartGetNum ( Int32 *  pInt,
UInt32  timeoutVal 
)

Reads integer from the UART console BspUtils_uartInit needs to be called prior to any uarRead.

Parameters
pInt[OUT] Character read from UART
timeoutVal[IN] timeout value in seconds
Returns
BSP_SOK upon success or return error
Int32 BspUtils_uartGetStr ( char *  pRxBuffer,
UInt32  bufSize,
UInt32  timeoutVal 
)

Reads string from UART console. This breaks on carraige return or timeout or char read exceeds the buffer size. This will also terminate the string with NULL character.

Parameters
pRxBuffer[OUT] Character read from UART
bufSize[IN] Length of the pRxBuffer in Bytes
timeoutVal[IN] Timeout value in seconds. Pass BSP_UTILS_UART_RX_WAIT_FOREVER to wait forever.
Returns
None
void BspUtils_uartInit ( void  )

Initiates Uart module.

This API should be called before calling read or print functions.

void BspUtils_uartPrint ( char *  string)

Prints the string on UART console.

Parameters
string[IN] String to be printed
